infoCollection.title: Information Collection and Use
infoCollection.description: At BuyMeACoffee-Africa, we value your trust and are committed to ensuring transparency in how your information is collected, stored, and used. We collect different categories of data to provide a seamless and secure experience, improve our services, and personalize your interactions within the platform. This section outlines in detail the types of data we collect, how we obtain it, and the specific purposes for which it is used.

types.title: 1. Types of Data Collected
types.description: We collect several types of data that help us deliver our services efficiently and securely. Depending on how you interact with our website or application, this may include:
types.personalDataDesc: Information that identifies you as an individual, such as your full name, email address, GitHub or Google username, and in some cases, your mobile money number. This data is typically collected when you register or authenticate using GitHub/Google OAuth.
types.usageDataDesc: Automatically collected data such as your IP address, browser type, device information, and pages visited. This helps us monitor system performance, maintain platform security, and improve the user interface.
types.cookiesDesc: We use cookies, tokens, and similar technologies to maintain your login session, remember preferences, and analyze site usage trends. You can choose to disable cookies, but doing so may limit some functionalities.
types.oauthDesc: When you connect your GitHub or Google account, we collect only the information necessary to authenticate your identity and display your public profile‚Äîsuch as your username, avatar, and linked email (if shared publicly).

how.title: 2. How We Collect Your Data
how.description: We collect data directly from you when you sign up, log in, or interact with features on our website. Additionally, certain technical and usage data are collected automatically through browser cookies, API calls, and analytics tools integrated into our platform. For OAuth-based authentication, information is securely fetched through GitHub or Google‚Äôs APIs under your explicit consent, following their respective privacy policies.
how.aggregatedData: Occasionally, we may also receive anonymized or aggregated data from analytics services (such as Vercel Analytics or Supabase Insights) to help us understand user engagement, technical performance, and application reliability.

purpose.title: 3. Purpose of Data Collection
purpose.description: We use your information only for legitimate and clearly defined purposes. The primary reasons we collect data include:

items.accountManagement: To create and manage your account securely through GitHub or Google authentication.
items.personalization: To display personalized content, user profiles, or transaction histories.
items.paymentProcessing: To process payments or donations via linked mobile money or other financial systems.
items.performanceMonitoring: To monitor technical stability, diagnose performance issues, and prevent fraudulent activities.
items.communications: To communicate important updates, policy changes, or service notifications.
items.legalCompliance: To comply with legal obligations and ensure a safe, transparent platform environment.

purpose.conclusion: Every piece of data collected serves a clear operational or improvement purpose. We do not collect data unrelated to the services we provide, and we do not engage in intrusive profiling or hidden data extraction practices.

legalBasis.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.description: For users in regions governed by data protection laws (such as GDPR in the EU), our legal basis for collecting and processing data may include:

consent.label: Consent:
consent.description: When you explicitly link your GitHub or Google account.

contractualNecessity.label: Contractual Necessity:
contractualNecessity.description: To provide the services you have requested or subscribed to.

legitimateInterest.label: Legitimate Interest:
legitimateInterest.description: For analytics, fraud prevention, and maintaining platform performance.

legalObligation.label: Legal Obligation:
legalObligation.description: When required by law to retain or disclose certain information.

dataRetention.title: 5. Data Retention
dataRetention.description: We retain your personal data only as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this Privacy Policy. Account-related data is stored until you delete your account or revoke access via OAuth. Certain system logs and anonymized analytics may be retained for a limited period (typically 90 days) to maintain platform integrity and support technical troubleshooting.

controlAndChoice.title: 6. Your Control and Choice
controlAndChoice.description: You always have control over your personal data. You may:

items.review: Review or update your account details through your GitHub or Google settings.
items.withdraw: Withdraw consent or unlink your OAuth account at any time.
items.requestDeletion: Request deletion of your stored information by contacting us directly.
items.disableCookies: Disable cookies through your browser preferences if you do not wish to be tracked.

controlAndChoice.conclusion: We strive to make all data handling transparent, giving users full visibility and control over how their information is used within our ecosystem.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.description: We may update our Privacy Policy periodically. We will notify users of significant changes by posting updates on this page and updating the effective date above.
